area_name: 07. River side of Main Massif or Quarry Wall

content.description: This climb starts in the corner under the orange colored wall.  Shares the same start as Confused but traverses up right where Confused goes left.  Climb up and around a corner to a ledge.  Pull up over the ledge and your on top.
content.protection: Medium cams and nuts or just solo it.
content.location: On the river side, look up the Main Massif when you pass a large 'triangular' boulder.
Climb "Leap of Faith" and then step over/jump the gap to the top of "Pretty Piece of Flesh". Rap on the anchors of the roof route to the north of Pretty Piece.

content.description: A mixed climb to the right of Aswan Dam Crack.
content.protection: Mixed, two bolts and a fixed nut. Small cams needed for the top.
content.location: To the right (north) of Aswan Dam Crack.
To find GALB, follow existing riverside trail towards The Brig and Aswan Dam Crack area.  The climb starts just before heading uphill to Aswan Dam Crack.  See attached edited map.

content.description:
Classic rockaneering up the river side of the main massif. This is probably the easiest way to the top of Petenwell Bluff. 

  Pitch 1 (3rd/4th): 

  Scramble up-and-to-the-right on an obvious ramp from the base of the massif to a saddle. At the saddle, move the belay (if you used one) by heading west across a slight gully falling away to the northwest. 

  Pitch 2 (Easy-5th): 

  After crossing the gully, you will find yourself deposited on a nice flat ledge at the north end of the main massif. Mantle onto the summit plateau and walk south to the summit block.
content.protection: A mix of slings, stances, and terrain belays should allow a competent leader to comfortably protect followers.
content.location: East side of the main massif. Easiest route to the summit of the entire formation.

content.description: I started in the corner beneath an orange colored wall with some very easy climbing and then traversed left and climbed up a slightly overhanging crack(crux).(see pictures)
content.protection: Small to medium nuts and cams.  Some gear for building an anchor at the top.
content.location: On the river side, look up the Main Massif when you reach a large triangular rock next to the trail.  (see pictures)

climbs.name: Aswan Dam Crack
climbs.fa: Leo H or Rich Bechler/Steve Sangdahl, early 80's

content.description: Two cruxes.  One moving past first bolt and one pulling above third bolt onto upper part of the route.
content.protection: Three bolts and anchor.  One can place crack gear to protect the first 25ft and easy part of the route.
content.location: Take bushy ledge system in a leftward traverse along base of wall to get to route base after leaving trail proper.

pathTokens: 07. River side of Main Massif or Quarry Wall

content.description: The opposite side (side facing the Wisconsin River or East facing exposure)of the Quarry Wall area which I believe is part of the highest and largest formation of the Pentenwell Rock area.
